THE MURTAUGH FAMILY OUT ON THE BOAT,
THE UNDERSIDE OF THE DIVING BOARD

INT, THE "INTACT" PORTION OF THE HOUSE
LIGHTS. TWO AMBULANCES. THREE FIRE TRUCKS. SIX TV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bans panics. He doesn't know how to fly a plane, but he wants to get the hell away . . . so he PUSHES FORWARD on the THROTTLE just enough to put the plane INTO MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE GULFSTREAM
dialogues.text: Riggs is on the staircase when the plane begins to TAXI FORWARD. The staircase TEARS AWAY from the Gulfstream's fuselage SPILLING Riggs to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs TUMBLES beneath the wing, where -- flat on his back -- he sees the LANDING GEAR ROLLING TOWARDS HIM!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Oooohhhhhh -- { He rolls out of harm's way -- the landing gear coming within inches of crushing him. But now Riggs must contend with the SEARING HEAT expelled from the Turbofan Jet Engine as it passes over him.

dialogues.speaker: THE LEADING EDGE OF THE GULFSTREAM'S WING
dialogues.text: SHEERS off the roof of the Ford Bronco as it passes by. Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCEDES
dialogues.text: SQUEALS away in cloud of exhaust smoke. But in their hurry to escape with their lives, the South Africans have forgotten about the TWO SUITCASES resting on the tarmac. The Mercedes PLOWS into them, sending them flying. One of them OPENS . . . and BUNDLES of U.S. CURRENCY spill out.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: gets to his feet. Murtuagh rushes up to him. The Glufstream is rolling off in one direction, and the Mercedes has driven off in the other.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (pointing at Gulfstream) That one is mine! You take the Benz! Riggs doesn't even wait for Murtaugh's reply. He just RUNS OFF after the Gulfstream. Murtaugh and the Drug Cops jump into the DECAPITATED BRONCO and speed away.

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCEDES LIMO
dialogues.text: races across the perimeter of the landing field. The Bronco chasing after it.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: chases the moving Gulfstream on foot -- running like a gazelle. He catches up to it -~ LEAPS onto the wing from behind and holds on tight. He works his way over the wing toward the OPENING IN THE FUSELAGE where the door used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: overtakes the Mercedes. Now they're side-by-side. GUNFIRE is exchanged out the windows of the two vehicles. The Mercedes attempts some wild evasive turns, but the Brenco sticks to it like glue.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: is on the wing of the Gulfstream, He tries to SWING INTO THE DOORWAY. His foot SLIPS. He aimost falls beneath the moving plane. He holds on tight with both hands . . . but LOOSES HIS BERETTA -- it slips from his belt azd BOUNCES on the ground. Riggs PULLS himself up into the airplane.

dialogues.speaker: INT, COCKFIT OF GULSTREAM
dialogues.text: Close quaters. Very cramped. Hans swirls to face Riggs, FIRES his gun. Misses. Riggs YANKS him out of the cockpit. ‘The fight is on.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, RUNWAY AND INFIELD
dialogues.text: The Mercedes cuts diagonally across the runway, headed toward the TERMINAL AREA. The Bronco right on its tail. They reach the AIRPORT APRON. This is where the planes dock and there is considerable GROUND SERVICE traffic in the area. Such as... A BAGGAGE TRAIN that crosses the Mercedes' path. No time to aveid it ~- CRASH! -- the Mercedes RAMS it! SPLITS it apart! Travels directly through it. Luggage scattered everywhere. The Bronce follows -- destroying the luggage even further -- dragging articles of clothing from its bumper. Suddenly ... A BOEING 727 that is being BACKED AWAY from the gate looms up iz front of the Mercedes. The Mercedes BRAKES -- SKIDS iz a pool of oil -~- SLEWS sideways out of contr towards a FUEL TRUCK. Ground Service CREW MEMBERS see it all unfolding and leap for safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Rolf are frozen with fear. But KARL, in the back seat, KICKS OPEN the door and BAILS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It SMASHES into the Fuel Truck. EXPLOSION! FIRE BALL! The Bronco swerves to avoid the inferno. Kar] rolis across the pavement, gets to his feet and RUNS. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE GULFSTREAM
dialogues.text: rolling -- with no one in control -- toward an ANCHOR FENCE at the airport's perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE GULSTREAM
dialogues.text: Riggs and Hans beat the shit out of each other. Hans knows as much about Martial Arts as Riggs does. Both men are being brutally punished. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl runs in, shouldering his way past several BAGGAGE HANDLERS who try to stop him, and HOPS ONTO THE CONVEYOR BELT that carries the luggage into the terminal. Shoving suitcases and parcels aside, he runs up the belt. Moments later MURTAUGH ARRIVES.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Police officer! Police officer! He flashes his badge without ever breaking stride. And when he sees the conveyor belt, he knows this is where Karl has gone. He leaps onto the belt as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl SLIDES down the shute onto the BAGGAGE CAROUSEL, upending himself and several pieces of luggage in the process. Startled PASSENGERS react to the sight. Karl heads for the Exit Door. But an AIRPORT SECURITY VEHICLE PULLING UP TO THE CURB outside causes him to change Girection.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: SLIDES down the shute onto the Carousel, KICKING pieces of baggage from his path, vaulting to the floor. Passenge have already become blase at the sight -~ they hardly even lock. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh spots Karl running ahead and chases him down Ae.se

dialogues.speaker: TERMINAL CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Patigue begins to set in for Murtaugh. He runs on rubber legs; PANTING and PUFFING. Up ahead are several REVOLVING DOORS. Passengers from arriving flights are using these doors to enter the Baggage Claim area. Karl waits for the doors to clear of people, then slips in. But guess what? These doors only turn in one directio When pushed the wrong way they LOCK and an ALARM SOUNDS. And that's what happens to Karl, He's trapped. Stuck inside the revolving door. He can't believe it. Murtaugh rushes towards him.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PUSHES IN ON KARL
dialogues.text: Does he throw up his hands and surrender? Not on your life. He PANICS -- he raises his gun and POINTS If AT MURTAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: swings up his own gun. At the same moment --

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE DRUG COPS
dialogues.text: arrive from the opposite direction. All WEAPONS EXPLODE. Bystanders SCREAM and duck for cover. The revolving door is SHATTERED and Karl's bullet riddled body PIROUTTES through the broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH AND THE DRUG COPS
dialogues.text: exchange an exhausted look as they holster their hand guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the knoll is the ANCHOR FENCE that surround the Airport. The knoll slopes gently downward do the BUSY HIGHWAY below. We watch as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GULFSTREAM TEARS THROUGH THE ANCHOR FENCE and SLIDES DOWN the embankment toward the Highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Hans are THROWN FORWARD as the plane drops -- TUMBLING head over heels down the center aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fhe Gulfstream trails a giant CLOUD OF DUST as it rolls across the highway. BRAKES SQUEAL. HORNS HONK. Traffic screeches to a halt. A CHAIN-REACTION of REAR~END COLLISI results. CRASH! CRASH! CRASH! The Gulfstream continues across the highway toward a BLUFF that overlooks the BEACH and the OCEAN BELOW. A sheer drop that would mean certain death for Riggs and Hans inside the plane.

dialogues.speaker: INT, THE GULFSTREAM
dialogues.text: Riggs glances through the windshield -- sees the bluff approaching. The hell with Hans, he's got to stop the plane. And that's just what he does -- PULLING BACK HARD ON THE BRAKE LEVERS. . But during this . . . HANS LEAPS OUT OF THE PLANE onto the highway below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fhe Gulfstream SKIDS TO A STOP with its NOSE WHEEL DANGLI over the cliff. PHEWH!

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: runs along the highway. Traffic has come to a complete stop for miles. People climb from their cars to gawk at the spectacle. So it isn't very hard for Hans to STEAL one of these cars, make a U-TURN and escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs appears in the doorway holding Hans' SUITCASE. A CROWD OF SPECTATORS pushes forward to get a look at him. The Ford Bronco ROARS up followed by TWO HIGHWAY PATROL CARS. SIRENS are SCREAMING. BUBBLE LIGHTS are FLASHING. Sensing Murtaugh's authority, the crowd parts, clearing a path for him. Riggs hops down from the Gulfstream.  [¢ Murtaugh marches up to him. Riggs looks pretty beaten e up and very pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What happened?? I stopped the plane, that's what happened!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Where's your guy?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What about your guys? How many collars did you make?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No collars. Three bodies. But at least they didn't get away.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Get off my back, I captured a plane and a suitcase full of money... and it's still before lunch.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (after a pause) Speaking of lunch, isn't there a hot dog stand a few miles down the beach from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS UP and AWAY as Riggs and Murtaugh push their way through the crowd, Someone's CAR RADIO is PLAYING LOUDLY:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: « » » @ KNXT Newsradio traffic tipster informs us that there's a a stalled jet plane tying up traffic on the Pacific Coast Highway in the LAX area. That's right! ... a Stalled jet plane. So if you're headed in that direction, look for an alternate route or expect to be stuck in traffic for most of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans rides up in the elevator. His arm is in a sling. His face bruised and swollen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it

dialogues.speaker: INT, ELEGANT OFFICE
dialogues.text: The private elevator opens directly into the office, which is tastefully, and expensively, appoixted with antiques and oriental rugs. Hans enters the office, which at first glanse seems empty. Then we notice him. Seated not at zis desk, but at a small table where he is eating his lunch. His name is ARJEN RUDD

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Hans. Come in. Sit down over here. Rudd indicates the chair across the table from him. As Hans comes forward, he realizes that he -s WALKING ON A SHEET OF PLASTIC that has been laid over the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Den't mind the plastic. I'm having some painting done. (beat) Sit down. Hans sits. Rudd is enjoying a thick steak ior lunch. He slices off a piece and slides it into hiz mouth. Hans sits nervously, waiting for Rudd to spzak.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: So tell me, Hans -- what went wrsag? The police were waiting. We los: a considerable amount of money, ncz to mention the airplane.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I don't know, Mr. Rudd. I workei out every detail myself. I left nothing to chance.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: I see. (beat) dust bad luck, huh? Rudd calmly cuts another piece of steak ané sops it into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: I think it was inevitable. Takicg the money out in small shipments is much too slow and much too dangezsus. We should do it all at one time, in one enormous shipment. Rudd doesn't reply to this suggestion. In fact, he changes the subject completely.  [t

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: How's the arm? You all right? (smiling) Live to fight another day? Hans relaxes. Reassured by Rudd's expression of concern.

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I'm fine. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Sometimes things simply do not turn out as we plan them. (smiles) This steak, for example. "Cajun" style. Look, it's all black. Do you like it that way, Hans?

dialogues.speaker: HANS
dialogues.text: Well, I... don't know.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Here. I want you to taste this and tell me what you think. Rudd slices off a piece of steak for Hans, spears it with his fork and offers it to him. As Hans leans forward to take the piece of meat in his mouth, we HEAR: PHHHITT! And Hans is propelled BACKWARDS in his chair. A BULLET through his FOREHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BENEDICT
dialogues.text: appears, having entered from the bathroom, holding a SILENCED PISTOL in his hand. He's a wiry, loose-jointed weasle with madness in his eyes and a perpetual smirk playing upon his lips. He looks down at Hans' body. Blood is pumping from his head wound onto the plastic sheet.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: You give new meaning to the word “dropcloth," Mr. Rudd. Benedict removes the ROLEX WATCH from Hans' wrist before wrapping up the body in the plastic.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Certain policemen in this city have become an intolerable nusiance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was saying the same thing just the other day. Maybe you heard my speech before the Junior League. Rudd is familiar with Benedict‘s peculiar sense of humor. He proceeds without reaction:

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Is your team assembled?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Ready and waiting. (meaning the Rolex: ) Say, can I keep this? Rudd voices no objections as Benedict slips the watch onto his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Hans was an incompetent piece of shit .. . but he had one good idea in his life, and he just gave it to me: One big shipment, That's exactly what we're going to do. Move it all out at once.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: You're going to need something bigger than a suitcase for that.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: That can be arranged. (beat) Now, about these cops . . . how do we handle them?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Ready to declare war?

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Not if we don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Then let's fire a warning shot across their bow. Hope they get the message. Rudd removes a PHOTOGRAPH from a folder.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Have a look. Benedict takes the photo . . . it's a PICTURE OF MURTAUGH

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: He's the cop in charge. Benedict practically licks his lips.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Oh this is going to be lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh strides across the room. CAPTAIN MURPHY falls into step with him.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Have you heard the grand total? Five point six million. Murtaugh WHISTLES; impressed at the amount. CAMERA PANS to FIND RIGGS. Seated in a chair, struggling to free himself from a STRAIGHT JACKET while the Drug Cops (Wyler, Price and Cavanaugh} look on.

dialogues.speaker: WYLER
dialogues.text: Give it up, Riggs. Murtaugh and Captain Murphy arrive. 6 To thee /4 >

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute, fifteen seconds.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: . CAVANAUGH
dialogues.text: Houdini here's bet us he can free himself inside of five minutes. Murtaugh reaches into his pocket and pulls out a roll ef bills.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I'll cover that bet. How much?

dialogues.speaker: WYLER
dialogues.text: Save your money, Sarge. One minute, Riggs. Riggs is building up to something. Straining against the jacket, his face flushes and the veins in his neck pop out... © Riccs © Don't try this at ingme , boys and girls... “® xy That's when WE HEAR a LOUD POP! and Riggs winces in pain. Murtaugh knows exactly what Riggs is up to.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (smiling) It's all over now. The Drug Cops are startled to see Riggs suddenly wiggling free of the jacket. Here's one hand -- and there's another. He unhooks the jacket and slips it off. The Drug Cops are astounded. They also moan and groan over having lost the bet.

dialogues.speaker: . PRICE
dialogues.text: How'd you do that? RIGGS © Dislocated my shoulder once... I can make it pop out if I want to.

dialogues.speaker: WYLER
dialogues.text: Doesn‘t that hurt? Riggs has now gotten to his feet.  /§

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. But not as much as when I pop it back in Which he does -- by SLAMMING his shoulder against the wall, then clenching his jaw against the pain.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Why do you do this to yourself?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I can't resist a challenge. Besides -- (as he scoops up his winnings) -- I need the money. Murtaugh goes to the coat rack and grabs his sports coat. Riggs follows him over.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Let's you and me try out@he new special down at the chy i Palace.

dialogues.speaker: MU GH
dialogues.text: (slipping on his jacket) Can't tonight. (beat) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Chili pizza. Murtaugh makes a disgusted face at the very sound of it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (softly) Rianne's commercial is on tonight.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Rianne's in a commercial?!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hey. Not so loud.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's the matter ~- aren't you proud of her?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Don't knew. Haven't seen it yet. (hushed) What if she stinks?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You kidding? She's gonna by dynamite. {turns to address the entire Squad Room) Hey! Listen up. Tonight... (to Murtaugh) What time?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: C'mon, man.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What time?!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Eight~fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What channel?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (still reluctang@y) Five. oe Riggs turns back to face the Bquad Room again. Spices Tonight. Channel five at eight-fifteen. The commercial debut of Rianne Murtaugh. The Sarge's beautiful daughter. Don't miss it. Riggs smiles at Murtaugh, but Murtaugh just gives him a sour look in return.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: She better not stink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh's SEDAN pulls into the driveway next to his fishing boat on its trailer. Riggs glides up to the curb in his PICKUP TRUCK. Both men climb out.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Follow me. Wanna show you something. Murtaugh leads Riggs around to the back of the house.

dialogues.text: 4 ROOM ADDITION is being added to the Murtaugh house. The framing is up. Some drywall. The windows are in, Murtaugh and Riggs enter the room by walking between two of the framing studs,

dialogues.text: A long-haired, 30 year old CARPENTER is down on his knees using a PNEUMATIAC NAIL GUN to install the plywood sub-fleoring. Each applicaticn of the gun generates a loud THAWOMP! sound.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Working late tonight. The Carpenter looks up, didn't even know Riggs and Murtau were standing there.

dialogues.speaker: CARPENTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, Wanted to get this sub-flooring @own today.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: Doesn't anybody use hammers anymore?

dialogues.speaker: ENTER
dialogues.text: What's a hannes®

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (staking his head) That's wagt I thought.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Whaddaya building here, Rog?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: Hobby room, Riggs nods. Silence. Then --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: I can retire when I'm fifty~two, you know. Get almost full benefits until I'm fifty~five when the whole free ride kicks in.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Fifty-two, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Only a couple months away.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You wanna retire?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Been thinking about it... (pause) . . . ever since I met yeu.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MIRTAUGH
dialogues.text: Anyway, now that I got me a hebby room, all I gottz do is --

dialogues.speaker: RISGS
dialogues.text: ~- find a hobby. They laugh together while eztering the house through a hole in the wall.

dialogues.text: THUNDERING FEET bounding down the stairs: Twelve year-old NICK MURTAUGH and his eight vear-cld sister, CARRIE. They run into the living rozm where Murtaugh, Riggs, TRISH MURTAUGH (Roger's wifs) and 19 year-old RIANNE have already gathered to watsh the TV. (Rianne, by the way, is a total knock czt.)

dialogues.speaker: C2RRIE
dialogues.text: Almost time! Are Wotaping this? aTEssH Yes, honey. Qe’ zan watch it over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE
dialogues.text: Nick! Don't ruiz this for me!

dialogues.speaker: TEISH
dialogues.text: Nick! This is important to your sister. Nick makes a face. Murtausgi, meanwhile, is adjusting the TV picture.

dialogues.speaker: MIRTAUGH
dialogues.text: Color's not good.

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE
dialogues.text: Daddy! ...

dialogues.speaker: TEISR

dialogues.text: Want my baby te lock good.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: fry unplugging it.  /7. Even Riggs has to stifle a grin at this.

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE
dialogues.text: Nick! Murtaugh steps away from the set with an appraising look.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Perfect picture, Rog.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (unconvinced) Think so? ... Murtaugh is about to sit on the sofa when he notices GEORGE for the first time. George is Rianne's boy friend.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Who's this?!

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hi... sir. 9 8

dialogues.text: George . . . do I ky you?

dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Don't you remember? Last week when I picked up Rianne. We had a long talk. . Murtaugh clearly has no recollection of this whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We did? About what?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Your new hobby room, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: Did we get along, George? I mean, aid you get the sense that I liked you?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I did. Very much so.

dialogues.speaker: . MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Okay. You can stay. But move dcwn. George moves over on the sofa making room for Murtaugh. Everyone's attention is glued to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming on! It's coming on! I'm so nervous -- Then, she sees herself on TV . . . and SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE
dialogues.text: -- here it isi! THIS IS RIANNE‘S COMMERCIAL: She smiles into the camera, A big, beautiful smile. Is this a toothpaste commercial? Then she turns and runs away from camera. We realize she’s on a beach « . » and she's wearing the SMALLEST BIKINI EVER MADE. She runs into the arms of a MALE MODEL whe is also wearin a bathing suit.

dialogues.text: Now, more than ever, love needs all the protection it canget. Rianne and the Male Model kis®@as a PACKET OF CONDOMS is supered over them. gt

dialogues.speaker: 4, ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Isn't it better . . . when you know it's safe? Then, Rianne and the Male Model turn toward the camera and intone:

dialogues.speaker: MALE MODEL
dialogues.text: We think so! And that's the end of it. Trish hits the mute button on the remote. The room falls silent. Murtaugh is glaring threatenly at Riggs, who squirms in his seat. Finally, Rianne breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: RIANNE
dialogues.text: I looked fat.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: No, you didn't, honey.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I liked it!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: George ..-.  Zi

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: -~ George, I have a gun. George leaps up from the sefa and heads for the door. Rianne goes after him. .

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Trish. Take the kids upstairs. Trish knows that tone of voice. She shcos Nick and Carrie up the stairs. Murtaugh begins to advance on Riggs. Riggs gets te his feet. RIGGS © Now wait a minute, R xr. She was great, She looked gr@at. What's the matter with yQae!

dialogues.speaker: AJURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Twelve months in acting school! Four thousand bucks tuition! For what?! So my kid can run across the beach half naked selling rubbers to teenagers!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS /

dialogues.text: Leo enters. The shower curtain is drawn across the tub. Leo pays no attention to this, but he is curious about the OPEN BATHROOM WINDOW, As he approaches to take a closer look, the SHOWER CURTAI is quietly pulled back and a South African HITMAN STEPS OUT OF THE TUB. Leo turns . . . but all he gets to see is the SHOWER CURTAIN being LOWERED over his head -- wrapped around his neck -- and pulled tight, shutting out the air. Leo's being ASPHYXIATED by the Hitman. He flails his arms and kicks his feet, but he's no match for the Hitman superior strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh continues to Past Forward through the tape. Then he stops .. . rewinds a little... plays it forward, We see what looks like more cf the same; the Murtaughs at play on the family boat. But Murtaugh sees something that we don't. He rewinds. Plays it again. Bends in close. Rewinds. Plays it again. Slow moticn. Very close to the screen. Looking hard. Rewinds. Plays it again. One frame at a time.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (hushed) I knew it. What's he looking at? In the background of one shot is a FREIGHTER. A great big ocean-going carge ship. And the name painted on the Freighter's bow is: NCRA DANE. Murtaugh actually touches his finger te the screen right where the name appears. MURTAUGE © (smiling) 9 Nora Dane. 8 Se Then: Murtaugh sees a REPLECTSON IN THE TV SCREEN. Someone behind him! He whigls around -- finds himself face to face with the SOUTH AFRICAN HITMAN. He doesn't think -~- he just reacts. He THROWS A PUNCH against the Hitman's jaw. The Hitman is propelled backwards against the wall, but BOUNCES BACK WITH A VENGEANCE. He overwhelms Murtaugh with a series of Martial Arts KICKS and JABS that fairly WHISTLE through the air. Murtaugh is beaten back into the:

dialogues.speaker: HOBBY ROOM
dialogues.text: Where he CRASHES to the floor within inches of the the CARPENTER'S TOOLS. The Hitman advances. Murtaugh SWINGS UP his arm, the PNEUMATIC NAIL GUN in his grasp. BAM! He fires a nail. THUNK! Right between the Hitman's eyes, The expression of surprise on his face is almost comical, He sinks to his knees and keals over onto his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh steggers to his feet, head reeling. Holding his side, he sturbles back into:

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Only to see a SECOND HITMAN approaching from across the room with a KNIFE in his hand. It takes Murtaucgh a moment to bring him into focus. The Hitman comes forward slowly, like a predatory animal Stalking wounded prey. Murtaugh rocks back and forth on his heels, still unsteady from the beating he just took. He raises the Nail Gun -- points it at the approach Hitman and fires -- BAM! The Hitman grabs a small END TABLE by the legs and uses its top as a shield, THUNK. The nail sinks into the wood. The Hitman keeps coming. Holding the table in front of him. Murtaugh AIMS LOWER ~- BAM! . . . The Hitman lowers the table -- THUNK . . . Murtaugh AIMS HIGHER ~~ BAM! . . . The Hitman raises the table -- THUNK. And that's the last nail Murtaugh og to fire, because the Hitman is now right on top of Sym -~ SWINGING the table through the air -~ SMASHING it against Murtaugh's skull. -9 Murtaugh's knees buckle, but ne doesn't go down, The Hitman RUSHES HIM, his knife pointed toward Murtaugh's gut. . They struggle. We HEAR the nail gun discharge: BAM! And the Hitman staggers backwards and falls |... a NAIL THROUGH HIS HEART.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: . {amazed} Sonofabitch . . . I nailed 'em both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh charges in.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Leo! But all he finds is the torn shower curtain and the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A HAND as it sweeps up a BEER CAN. Shakes it. Shoves it under the nose of . . . LEC GETZ. The hand SNAPS THE TAB, Beer EXPLODES out of the can, SPRAYIN up Leo's nose with great force. Leo rears his head back in distress. CHCXES. Spits. GAGS. GASPS for air, Beer pours from his nose and mouth. He's drowning on suds. -CAMERA PULLS BACK to include BENEDICT. Szoking one of his thin cigars.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Where's the money, Leo? Hew much did you take? We want it back, Lec! Where is it?! Leo is TAPED to a chair, like Trish and Murtaugh were taped to their bed. Leo doesn't answer. He blows beer out of his nose and tries to clear his throat. Benedict grabs another beer and shakes it up.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: What's the deal, Leo? You'll talk to the Feds but not to me?! That's not fair. That hurts my feplings! He shoves the second beer under Led®s nose. Lec tries to turn his head away, but a Sou African Hitman forces it back around, Benedict POPS, QJE TAB with the same results as before. . » Leo chokes, spits and nearly diés. CAMERA PULLS BACK to include RIGGS. Seated next to Leo, Also taped to his chair, but with his mouth taped shut. as well. And Riggs is SCREAMING IN ANGER behind the tape. Benedict RIPS it off.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: You got something to say!?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You bastard! You're dead! Yceu're dead!

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: No, Riggs ~~ you're the one whe's dead!  /Of:

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You killed Tom Wyler, you senofabitch! You killed him while he was hanging upside down, completely helpless! I found your fucking cigar butt on the floor!

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Yeah. I did Tommy. I killed hin. So what? I enjoyed it. It was fun. Riggs SPITS in Benedict's face. Benedict SLAPS Riggs hard.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: All right, you little shit. Now I'm gonna tell you something that's gonna blow your fucking mind! You ready for this, because this is gonna make you come unglued! {beat ) Four years ago when you were working as a Narc in Long Beach, there was a contract out on you and I handled it. That's right, I rapyour fuckirg car off the road. onigeyou weren't in it! ‘@ (beat) a Imagine my surpris® when I pulled back this mattedAmop of blood~soaked hair and saw a woman's face. (beat) She didn't die right away, either. She took awhile. Benedict was right . . . Riggs is coming unglued. His face flushes. The veins in his neck pop out. He struggles against the tape that holds him down.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Where the hell were you, Riggs?! Xou were supposed to be driving that cer, not your damned wife! RIGGS. You fucking sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: The funny part was, by killing her, we killed you, too, Because after that, you crawled into a bottle and died.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: But now I'm back!  e

dialogues.speaker: EENEDICT
dialogues.text: Hell, you ain’t nowhere, Riggs. And I'll tell you something else + + . this is gonna be the worst night of your life. EXT. A FISHING BOAT - THE OCEAN - NIGHT. The boat bobs in the water, Riggs is on deck, wearing a VEST made of METAL CHAIN with LEAD WEIGHTS attached to it. The two South African Hitman wrestle Riggs to the bkeat's gunwale. Riggs struggles and kicks, The Hitmen POUND him a few times in the face.

dialogues.speaker: EITMAN ONE
dialogues.text: Any last words? Riggs coughs and spits blood through now swollen lips.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You're under arrest. You have the right to remain silent.

dialogues.speaker: HITMAN ONE
dialogues.text: Smart mouth, huh? © . The South Africans CLOBBER Riggs igthe face some more, then DUMP HIM OVER THE SIDE, . UNDERWATER ae Riggs’ weighted vest PULLS ait SuRateRT DOWN, fifteen feet, to a sand bar below. The water's cold and dark. We can barely make out Riggs. He HITS BOTTOM, raising a cloud of sand in the water. DIMLY SEEN OBJECTS sway lazily in the current.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE WATER
dialogues.text: One of the South Africens angles a SEARCHLIGHT down toward the water.

dialogues.speaker: HITMAN TWO
dialogues.text: Let's give him a show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly flooded with LIGHT. Jesus Christ! We get the shock of our lives . . . those "dimly seen objects" turn out to be CORPSES! And Riggs is right in the middle cf them.  All in various stages of decomposition and wrapped in chains. Rolling and shifting with the ocean current. Staring up from dead, fish-eaten faces. Clothes retted away in tatters. Some little more than skeletons. Except one... . JILL! . . . still beautiful, even in Geath. Her naked body white as marble. Riggs can't believe his eyes. Horror and pain fill his expression. But now he fights back harder than ever.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE WATER
dialogues.text: The Two South Africans peer into the water, see the TURBULENCE below, the signs of struggle. HITMAN Two How long?

dialogues.speaker: HITMAN ONE
dialogues.text: Minute ten. And still kickin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs thrusts against the chain vest, pulling it tight across his back -- POP! -~ dislocates hi houlder. A silent scream of agony as the chains ip and loosen. ABOVE WATER - IN THE BOAT age The South Africans look over the port side of the boat when Riggs EXPLODES OUT OF THE WATER on the starboard side, He leaps into the boat like a mad demon, one arm hanging limp. The South Africans turn, but don't have a chance, Riggs is upon them before they Know it. And he kills them both . . . TWISTING THE NECK of one . .. SNAPPING the other's BACKBONE over his knee. And then, Riggs releases a PRIMAL SCREAM of anguish and pain as he JAMS his SHOULDER back into its socket by SLAMMING it against the wheel-house wall. : cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know exactly what's going on here. Riggs is wrapping a HEAVY CHAIN around something that resembles a telephone POLE.  ‘@ (04. MLURTAUGH IS WITH HIM, The two men exchange a lock that is GRIM and DETERMINED,

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Let's do it. Murtaugh drives away in his Police Sedan. Riggs watches him depart, then climbs into the cab of his truck, He turns on the ignition and FLOORS THE GAS PEDAL. The BACK TIRES SPIN MADLY in the soft dirt . . . the motor ROARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict hears the ROARING TRUCK MOTOR from the canyon below and comes cut onto the deck. He peers down into the darkness. Riggs has wrapped the chain around the CORNER STILT that supports the house. The other end cf the chain is attached to the Truck .. . and Riggs is pulling the house down! Benedict has only a moment to register a look of alarm before a LOUD CRACK echoes across the qgnyon, and the deck begins to LIST and SWAY beneath Sis feet. — . a All hell has broken loose. The house has begun to SHIFT! The SOUNDS of timbers CRACKING; ”*nails CREAKING as they bend and pull free; plaster BREAKING; windows SHATTERING; water pipes BURSTING; gas lines RUPTURING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MURTAUGH RUSHES IN from the front door. TWO SOUTH AFRICAN GUNMEN enter from the hallway. EVERYONE FIRES AT ONCE -- BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! When the smoke clears, only Murtaugh is left standing.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: sees Murtaugh inside the house. He RAISFS HIS GUN and FIRES .. . but the shot goes wild because Benedict has literally DROPPED FROM VIEW as .. .

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE SNAPS IN TWO
dialogues.text: The half supported by stilts (the half that Benedict is standing on) SLIDES DOWN THE CANYON. The rest of the house, the portion built on selid ground at the top of the canyon, remains behind. (This is where Murtaug is.)  ‘e 105 The SLIDING PORTION OF THE HOUSE plows a wide swath through the trees and underbrush as it CRASHES down into the canyon in a cloud of DUST and DEBRIS.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Benedict clings to a doorway with both hands as FURNITURE FLIES past him. Then he sees something out the opening where the deck's sliding glass doors used to be: The house is on a collision course with the TRUNK OF A DEAD OAK TREE. It protrudes from the ground at a 45 degree angle. Benedict SCREAMS as the house RUSHES toward the tree trunk. SMASH! The tree trunk RIPS THROUGH THE HOUSE with tremendous force, halting its forward progress down the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS HOPS FROM HIS TRUCK
dialogues.text: He is triumphant. The only man in the history of the L.A.P.D. ever to have brought down a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs enters with his Beretta leveled. He chokes on the dust. It's so thick he can hardly see. The place has been DEMOLISHED. It doesn't even resemble a house anymore. Especially with this ENORMOUS TREE TRUNK taking up so much room. Riggs picks his way through the debris. And then he SEES BENEDICT: PINNED between the tree trunk and the wall. Only his his upper body is visible . .. and he's in agony. Riggs approaches him cautiously. Benedict stares down at Riggs. His eyes glassy, but filled with hate.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: (barely gets the words out) + « « you just won't die, will you? Riggs regards him with loathing. Benedict struggles to bring up his arm. He's still holding his pistol. He tries to aim it at Riggs, but doesn’ t have the streng to pull the trigger. The gun slips from his hand, and he dies with his eyes wide open.

dialogues.speaker: INT, THE "INTACT" PORTION OF THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Leo (still taped to a chair) sits in the GAPING HOLE where the house split apart ~- his chair practically TEETERING on the edge. He'd be enjoying a PANORAMIC VIEW of the canyon and beyond, except for the fact that his eyes have been taped shut. Murtaugh rushes to his rescue. He pulls Leo's chair away from the brink of disaster, then gently removes the tape from his mouth and eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: Hi, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Sgt. Murtaugh! God, am I glad to see you! I didn't know what was going on! Sounded like somebody was pulling the house down.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Somebody was. Murtaugh indicates the gaping hole in the house. Leo turns to see it. . . and jumps te a very logical conclusi

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Sgt. Riggs is alive! As if on cue, Riggs STRIDES IN.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You bet I am.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What about Benedict? Riggs shakes his head, no.

dialogues.speaker: " MURTUAGH
dialogues.text: Shoot him?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No. You might say he went out on a limb,

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You want Rudd next?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Do you have to ask? Murtaugh pulls off the tape from Leo's ankles and wrists. Leo stands up. Wiggles his fingers to bring back the circulation.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Then you better hurry. I heard him talking to Benedict. They taped up everything but my ears. He's leaving the country. Today. And he's taking his cash with him. Riggs and Murtaugh exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I'm in the mood to spoil that -bastard's travel plans. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Sure... any ideas how to find him? Riggs just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. VINCENT THOMAS BRIDGE -. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Riggs' Pickup Truck speeds across the high, arching bridge that crosses the L.A. Channel near the mouth ef the Harbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs is behind the wheel. Murtaugh and Leo are squeezed into the seat next to him. A FLASHING, BEEPING RED LIGHT on a RECEIVING UNIT attache to the dashboard is directing Riggs toward Rudd's Mercede

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The letters "N-O-R-A-D-A-N ~ E" come INTO FRAME one at @ time as the CAMERA PANS across the bow of the ship. The ship is docked beside a LOADING PIER. We see Riggs' Pickup Truck traveling slowly down the pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they drive down the pier, the BEEPING SOUND grows LOUDER and LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I don't see it.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's here someplace. (meaning the beeper) This thing is going crazy.  ‘@ /08

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Pull over and park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Murtaugh and Leo climb out of the Pickup. They have parked beside an area where GIANT STORAGE CONTAINERS rest on FLAT-BED TRUCKS awaiting loading onto cargo ships. (Note: These Containers are enormous. They're as large as the trailers of the biggest eighteen wheelers Riggs carries the Receiving Unit in his hand. The BEEPING LIGHT is going wild.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: It's coming from that container. As they move toward the Container, Murtaugh notices that Leo is tagging along.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Didn't I tell you to wait in the truck?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Well, I meant te.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Too late now. During this exchange, Riggs has climbed onto the bed of the truck on which the Container is resting.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Roger! Look at this. Murtuagh forgets about Leo, and hurries onto the flatbed truck to join Riggs. Leo is right behind him. Riggs indicates a STICKER attached to the CONTAINER DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: (reading what it says) “Official Diplomatic Seal of the Nation of South Africa.”

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Know what that means, Rog? This Container is a Diplomatic Pouch.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Right. Protected under Article 27 of the Vienna Convention.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Right. (beat) Screw Article 27.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Right. Riggs FIRES TWO SHOTS into the lock, Then they swing open the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Murtaugh and Leo are confronted with a STACK OF BUNDLES. These bundles ~- which are perfectly square and wrapped in brown paper ~~ rise to ceiling of the Container.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Close the doors. Leo SHUTS the doors behind them. Now they're in the DARK.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: Shit. Can't see a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fix that. Riggs WALKS AROUND the large stack of bundles and finds what he knew would be there: RUDD'S MERCEDES. He opens the deor and turns on the HEADLIGHTS. Now the Container is filled with a HARSH LIGHT that casts EERIE SHADOWS against the Container's walls and ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: That's great. Help us with this. Riggs returns to help Murtaugh and Leo RIP AWAY the brown paper wrapping. And this is what they discover underneath: MONEY! BUNDLES and BUNDLES of it. STACKS and STACKS of it. ROWS and ROWS of it. TWO THOUSAND CUBIC FEET of U.S. Currency in 20, 50, 100 and 1000 Dollar demoninat

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Holy shit. .  0.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Holy shit is right. (beat) Do you know what we're looking at here?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Yeah. From here to here ~~ that's a house in Beverly Hills. This section over here -~ that’s a Rolls Royce and two Ferraris. This part here -- this is a lifetime of comfort and ease.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: This is drug money, Roger. Probably just a month's worth of profits.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Let's see . . . 27 cubic feet of twenty dollar bills equals five million dollars ... (pulls out a pocket calculator) This container is about ten feet tall by eight feet wide... stack's about six feet deep... (taps in the numbers) Jesus! All I stole was a few hundred thousand. These guys are getting away with hundreds of millions! Murtaugh holds a WRAPPED BUNDLE in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MURTUAGH
dialogues.text: Look at this. These are thousand @ollar bills! What I'm holding in my hand could put all three of my kids through college! {beat} And I could fit it in my pocket. Silence. Riggs, Murtaugh and Leo all share a look,

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: When I turn my back, Roger, you can do anything you want. Riggs moves off, leaving Murtaugh to battle the demons of his conscience. Murtaugh glances at the money, then at Leo, then tosses the money back. Lee is impressed by Murtaugh's honesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: if.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudd and TWO SOUTH AFRICAN HIT MEN walk down the pier toward the container. Rudd looks upset. He glances at this watch.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Benedict?! Did you call his house?

dialogues.speaker: HIT MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I --

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: -- was he there?

dialogues.speaker: HIT MAN
dialogues.text: I don't know --

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: ~~ did he answer!? Was the line busy?!

dialogues.speaker: HIT MAN
dialogues.text: Nobody answered. The phone was out of order. This news makes Rudd grow visibly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: We can't wait any longer! Load the container!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We've got to make sure this Container doesn't go anywhere. . Suddenly, they feel something.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Shit. We're moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Container is being driven down the pier on the Flat-B Truck toward the loading area. Rudd and the Two Hit Men walk along beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs, Murtaugh and Leo peek out the crack where the doors meet. They can't see anything except the pier passing beneath them.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: See anybody?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Okay. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Stay with the container.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: I say we jump.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: By myself?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We're partners.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Then stay with me. Then, they come to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We've stopped.

dialogues.speaker: MURTUGH
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: We jump out.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You keep changing your mind.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: To fit the situation, yes! Murtaugh pushes on the doors, but they DON'T MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: They're stuck. They won't open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now parked beneath the LOADING CRANE. (This is a huge four-legged crane that's as tall as a five-story building. It straddles the entire width of the pier.) A Traveling Carriage, called a CRAB, is lowered from above. It GRABS HOLD of the Container, preparing to hoist it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs and Murtaugh hear the NOISE OVERHEAD as the Crab CLAMPS onto the Container.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (looking up) What the hell was that? Now they feel a very strange sensation as the Container is LIFTED UPWARD.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We're going up!

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I‘ve been on this ride before. It's called "Free Fall."

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You better hope not. Murtuagh puts his shoulder into the doors and they SWING OPEN. But now they're FORTY FEET IN THE AIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Hit Men LOOKS UP .. . SEES Murtaugh in the open Container doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh jumps back from the opening.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: They saw me.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Maybe they didn't. This is followed by the SOUND. OF MACHINE GUN FIRE as bullets RIP UP through the bottom of the Container.  ‘e e 4

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: No. Sgt. Murtaugh was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Hit Men aim their weapons in the air, SHOOTING up into the Container. Rudd SHOUTS up to the OPERATOR'S CAGE to have the Contain lowered.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Bring it down! Bring it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE TEARS THROUGH the bottom of the Container. Riggs, Murtaugh and Leo manage to dodge the bullets, but they know the odds are against them.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: We're going back down! They're taking us down. Inspiration strikes Martin Riggs:

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Get in the Mercedes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riggs climbs in behind the wheel. Next to him is Murtaugh Leo in back, as usual.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: This time ~- I get to drive! Riggs pulls a cluster of wires from under the dashboard, crosses the right ones and the MOTOR FIRES UP. All Riggs and Murtaugh can see out the windshield is a WALL OF MONEY .. . but they know there's a pair of cargo doors on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: What about all that cash?

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Blast right through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudd and the Hit Men watch as the Container is lowered.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Don't let them get away this time! Kill those sonsofbitches!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming down. Thirty-five feet high . . . thirty feet . . . twenty-five feet...

dialogues.speaker: INT, THE MERCEDES, (INSIDE THE CONTAINER)
dialogues.text: Riggs has the gear in neutral and the pedal pushed to the floor. The Mercedes' motor is literally SCREAMING at 5,000 RPM's -- the NOISE RESONATING within the metal Container.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Fasten your seat belts. Suddenly, they feel the Container jerk to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: That's it. We've hit bottom. With the MOTOR RACING . . . Riggs jams the gear shift lever into Drive .. . and the Mercedes ROCKETS FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cargo Doors EXPLODE OPEN and the Mercedes FLIES OUT . . . PUSHING 2,000 Cubic Feet of MONEY ahead of it. One little problem. . . the Container hasn't reached the pier yet. Something got stuck. It's still SUSPENDED FIFTEEN FEET IN THE AIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cloud of money clears, Riggs, Murtaugh and Leo realize that the pier is well below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shhhhhitttti!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudd and the Hit Men look up to see an AIRBORNE MERCEDES emerging through a FLURRY OF CURRENCY . . . and it's coming right at them. Rudd STUMBLES BACKWARDS, The Hit Men DIVE for safety.

dialogues.speaker: HG
dialogues.text: The Mercedes CRASHES DOWN onto the pier. The SCUND OF IMPACT is tremendous, but a Mercedes is built like a tank, and the car remains intact. The Hit Men scramble to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS AND MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: leap from the car with GUNS BLAZING. The Hit Men don't get off a shct -- both of them are BLOWN AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: looks dazed es MONEY FALLS FROM THE SKY and lands all around him. Some of it is caught by the wind, and sent swirling dowz the pier. Riggs marches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeu'tre finished, Rudd. It's all over. Rudd stares at Riggs with a pathetically bewildered expression. Riggs turns his back on him, SNATCHING A HUNDRED DOLLAR BILL out of the air.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (smiling) Eey, Rog .. . money from heaven. Murtaugh smilies . . . and then his expression changes to one of horror because Rudd has PULLED A KNIFE and he's rushing up behind Riggs with it.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: Riggs -- !! fhe warning is too late. Rudd STICKS the knife into Riggs' back right above his hip bone -- then pulls it out again. Riggs' eyes go wide as a SHOOTING PAIN, like a thousand volts of electricity, courses through his body. He STAGGERS towerd Murtaugh and Leo with an alarmed, uncomprehending expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Reger? . . . Roger!! He falls inte Leo's arms. Leo holds him up, keeps him from falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh SWINGS UP HIS PISTOL in a two-handed grip. He is seething ~~ quaking -- with a blind fury as he points the gun at Rudd. Rudd holds up his DIPLOMATIC CREDENTIALS like a shield in front of his face.

dialogues.speaker: RUDD
dialogues.text: Diplomatic immunity!!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Just been revoked! Murtaugh FIRES! The bullet TEARS A HOLE through Rudd's credentials . .. then tears a hole through Rudd's head, the impact propelling him backwards. Leo craddles Riggs in his arms. Murtaugh bends down to him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, Roger . .. it hurts like hell.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Take it easy, buddy. You been stuck before. You been stuck before. Murtaugh and Leo exchange a worried expression as SIRENS of APPROACHING POLICE CARS are heard in the distance. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The pier is SWARMING WITH COPS now. Riggs is being placed inside an AMBULANCE. Murtaugh hops in with him. The doors close. The Ambulance SPEEDS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: LEO IS LEFT BEHIND
dialogues.text: He watches the Ambulance depart. In all the confusion, nobody pays any attention to him. He SLIPS AWAY. . DISAPPEARING into the crowd. INT, THE AMBULANCE . A PARAMEDIC attents to Riggs who lies on his side, grimac in pain. Murtaugh comforts him.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: I don't wanna die, Roger...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: You won't. Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Don't... wanna... die...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Say it again! Keep sayin' -- Murtaugh stops in mid-sentence, Riggs' eyes have fluttere shut.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No. ... mo way! You're breathin'! You're alive! You're not dead! Riggs sure looks dead. The Paramedic urgently checks for signs of life.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: No! Don't die. You're not dead until Itell you! Got that!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: (weakly) Go spit... Murtaugh has never looked more relieved in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where the SAFETY DEPOSIT BOXES are kept. A MAN enters. We can't see his face. His collar is turned up. He wears dark glasses and a hat with the brim pulled down. He proceeds to empty the contents of two large boxes into a suitcase. Of course, we're talking about money. SEVERAL HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS in large demonination bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man emerges from the vault area with his heavy suitca He only takes a few steps before he's GRABBED BY BOTH ARMS. It's Riggs and Murtaugh. Riggs has him by one arm; Murtaugh by the other. Riggs removes the man's hat. Murtaugh removes his sunglasses. It's Leo. And he looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Sgt. Riggs. Sgt. Murtaugh ...

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Hi, Leo. How ya been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What's up, Lec? What's in the suitcase? Leo is very uncomfortable. He looks around in all directi

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Is there someplace we can talk in private?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Sure. .What about my car? It's parked right outside. That's when they SNAP THE CUFFS on him.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Oh, no. C'mon, guys. Gimme a break. After all we been through. Don't do this to me.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Let's go, Leo. They take him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They guide Leo into the back of the Police Sedan parked at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murtaugh drives. Riggs next to him. Leo in back. The car pulls away from the crub.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Guys, please. Have a heart. Don't take me in. I'm no use te the Feds anymore. Everybody who I was gonna testify against is dead. You guys should know that ~~ you're the ones who killed ‘em!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Shut up, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Why did I ever give myself up in the first place!? That was my big mistake!

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: No, Leo. You did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some comfort that is to me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Sedan races South on the Freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo looks out the window with an alarmed expression.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Hey! Where we going? You missed the turn-off!

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Shut up, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic is backed up for miles in both directions as autos crawl through the CUSTOMS STATIONS. Murtaugh's Police Sedan, however, slides into a special lane for Official Vehicles. Murtaugh flashes his badge and he is waved through. EXT. MEXICAN ROAD —- DAY The Police Sedan pulls off the road and parks. The . car's front doors fly open and Riggs and Murtaugh jump out. Now they remove Leo from the back seat, along with his suitcase. Leo regards them expectantly .... anda little apprehensively. - Riggs REMOVES THE CUFFS from Leo's wrists.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Hey .. . what is this? ...

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You're free, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: But .. . why?

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGE
dialogues.text: Because we like you. Okay? Riggs turns, puts two fingers into his mouth and WHISTLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (zi.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Pepe! Over here! Twelve year-old PEPE comes over leading a BURRO on a rope. The Burro is pulling a two-wheeled CART. Riggs loads the suitcase into the cart.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: {to Leo) See? We thought of everything. Leo looks overwhelmed. Murtaugh reaches out to shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Adios, Leo. But instead of shaking hands, Leo gives Murtaugh a hug. Murtaugh looks embarrased,

dialogues.speaker: MURTAUGH
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Now Leo turns to Riggs.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I'll never forget you guys.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: You could if you tried. Leo gives Riggs a hug. Riggs WINCES in pain.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Careful, Leo. That's where the knife went in. Leo steps back.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: {to Murtaugh) Come on. Let's get out of here before we change our minds. Riggs and Murtaugh climb into the car. Murtaugh starts up the motor. Riggs leans out the window.

dialogues.speaker: RIGGS
dialogues.text: Hey, Leo . . . will you do something for Roger and me?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Sure. You name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live like a king. And then, the Police Sedan peels away in a thick cloud of Mexican dust as Leo watches, silently waving his hand.
